p: On the other hand, in choosing vegetable resources as well as byproducts from the industry sector, we aim to improve not only the livestock productivity and alleviate the environmental burden, but also improve the quality of the products in order to meet consumer requirements. The goal was to increase the consumption of saturated fat by increasing feed use and feed quality. Dugan et al. [ 6] specified that, due to the proven positive effects of n-6:n-3 fatty acids (FA) in comparison to saturated FA, this knowledge has increased the tendency to select healthful resources for animal feeding. The ingredients selected manipulate the ratio of n-6:n-3 PUFA (polyunsaturated FA) toward a level beneficial for health.
